intro: Boehmeria pilushanensis, commonly known as the Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color. Boehmeria pilushanensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
